node.title: Analyst who aided Trump-Russia dossier charged with lying
node.alt: The vague outline of a person can be seen through a rippled frosted glass front door.
node.description: A US-based Russian analyst who was was aÂ significant source for a widely criticised dossier about Donald Trump's relationship with Russia during the 2016 election has been arrested on charges of lying to the FBI.
node.content: ["A Russian analyst who contributed to a dossier of Democratic-funded research into ties between Russia and Donald Trump has been arrested on charges of lying to the FBI about his sources of information, among them an associate of Hillary Clinton.", "The case against Igor Danchenko is part of special counsel John Durham's ongoing investigation into the origins of the FBI's probe into whether Mr Trump's 2016 campaign and Russia had conspired to tip the outcome of that year's presidential election.", "The indictment is the third criminal case brought by Mr Durham and the second in two months.", "The case does not undercut investigators' findings that the Kremlin aided the Trump campaign \u2014 findings that were not based on the dossier \u2014 but it does endorse a longstanding concern that opposition research the FBI relied on in the Russia probe was marred by uncorroborated claims.", "The five-count indictment accuses Mr Danchenko of making multiple false statements to the FBI when interviewed in 2017 about his role in collecting information for Christopher Steele, a former British spy who was paid by Democrats to investigate connections between Mr Trump and Russia.", "Mr\u00a0Danchenko, a US-based Russian who had specialised in Russian and Eurasian matters as an analyst at the Brookings Institution think tank, was a significant source for Mr Steele as he compiled his dossier.", "That dossier, the target of intense derision from Mr\u00a0Trump, was ultimately provided to the FBI and used by federal authorities as they applied for and received surveillance warrants targeting a former Trump campaign aide.", "According to the indictment, Mr Danchenko repeatedly lied to the FBI about his sources of information and that deception mattered because the FBI \"devoted substantial resources attempting to investigate and corroborate the allegations\" in the dossier and had \"relied in large part\" on that research in obtaining the surveillance warrants.", "A lawyer for Mr Danchenko had no immediate comment.", "The indictment says Mr Danchenko misled the FBI by denying that he had discussed any allegations in the dossier with a contact of his who worked as a public relations executive and was also a long-time Democratic operative who campaigned for Ms Clinton.", "The indictment says Mr\u00a0Danchenko had sourced one or more allegations in the dossier anonymously to that Clinton associate, who is not named in court papers.", "The Justice Department's inspector-general has faulted the FBI and the Justice Department for their handling of the dossier.", "Cybersecurity lawyer Michael Sussmann has pleaded not guilty to lying to the FBI during a 2016 conversation, with\u00a0Mr Durham's team saying\u00a0he concealed from the FBI that he was presenting the concerns as a lawyer for the Clinton campaign.", "Last year, Kevin Clinesmith, a former FBI lawyer, admitted altering an email related to the surveillance of Trump aide\u00a0Carter Page.", "AP"]
